intro: Elaeodendron pilosum, commonly known as the hairy elaeodendron, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of Africa. Its leaves are alternate and have a distinctive pubescent texture, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain numerous seeds. Elaeodendron pilosum is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
